thread.title_full: Women are getting freckles tattooed on their faces | New York Post

author: Raquel Laneri
title: Women are getting freckles tattooed on their faces | New York Post
text:
Once upon a time, freckles were considered such aberrations that women would do anything to get rid of, or at least conceal, them.
Talk about an about-face: Now, freckles are downright desirable.
Topshop and other beauty purveyors sell â€œ freckle pencils ,â€ while Kickstarter-funded company Freck Yourself offers stencil-like adhesives that will leave your skin all sun-kissed and speckled. But hardcore freckle fetishists can go a step further: They can get these spots tattooed on their faces.
Semipermanent freckle tattoos use pigment in lieu of ink, can last up to three years and cost about $250, according to the site NewBeauty .
â€œIâ€™d say for freckles, itâ€™s clients who naturally will get some in the summertime with sun exposure, but want them yearlong,â€ Montreal-based tattoo artist Gabrielle Rainbow tells the beauty publication. Rainbow first experimented with faux freckles after seeing her best friend struggling with painting on a smattering of specks on her face each morning.
â€œI really donâ€™t recommend tattooing your own face,â€ Rainbow tells NewBeauty. â€œBut once I saw that it worked out, and I liked the effect, I decided to do hers.â€
My clients are the prettiest, freshly done eyebrows and freckles on @sarahtellierd. ğŸ˜ yes all those freckles are fake ğŸ™ŒğŸ» â€“ #cosmetictattoo #tattoo #permanentmakeup #cosmetictattooing #brows #permanenteyebrows #micropigmentation #eyebrows #eyebrowsonfleek #eyebrowfeathering #cosmetic #permanentmakeup #fakefreckles #tattooedfreckles 
A post shared by Gabrielle â£ Twin Peonies (@gabriellerainbow) on Dec 27, 2016 at 11:45am PST 
Faux freckles are just the latest beauty trend celebrating so-called â€œimperfections.â€ Two years ago, designers and fashion editors went gaga over braces , outfitting their runway models teeth with orthodontia or putting metal-mouthed adolescents on their fancy magazine covers.
Meanwhile, unruly eyebrows a la Frida Kahlo and thick glasses â€” a fixture at the always-hot Gucci shows â€” have become must-have accessories. Two days ago, model India Rose Instagrammed a photo of herself backstage at Maison Margielaâ€™s couture presentation, with the caption, â€œAll I want this season is a show that gives me freckles again.â€
But while drawing spots on oneâ€™s face is one thing, getting them tattooed is quite another. For one, a needle can puncture the skin too deeply, or the tattoo artist can use inks that may cause infections.
â€œBecause this is your face, itâ€™s important that you do your research and find artists who arenâ€™t afraid to show their portfolio and healed work,â€ Rainbow tells NewBeauty. â€œEven if this is â€˜semipermanent,â€™ there are risks.â€
Lil shout out to some people who have done wonderful things to my face. @missmelissatattooer for my wonderful #tattooedfreckles to @sydneydyercosmetics for my beautiful #tattooedeyebrows and to @piercerdan for my #septumpiercing and my #philtrum thanks so much guys for making me feel the most beautiful!! ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜ğŸ˜˜
